result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eric W Larson

records.addlTxt:
2:04 PM Judge Anthony Stella Jr. appears by video from the Iron County Courthouse. Defendant Eric W Larson appeared by video.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Eric W Larson.  Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court addresses the DEF if he is satisfied to have this hearing by zoom. DEF agrees, Court acknowledges the waiver. Attny Thomas-Schmidt acknowledges information, waives reading. Atty Thomas-Schmidt request Not Guilty pleas to be entered for all counts. Court enters NG Plea to all counts. Court finds probable cause and binds DEF over for trial. State does not object to setting a status conference. All parties agree, Court schedules.
Status conference scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on December 5, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Application for specific judicial assign approved

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM  Defendant Eric W Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt appeared by video for Eric W Larson.   Attorney Kenneth Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Attny Thomas-Schmidt indicates to proceed with preliminary hearing.    State calls witness, Deputy Casey Culhane, sworn in by court.   State begins examination.    11:42 AM  Witness identified the DEF,  Attny Thomas-Schmidt no objection, court indicates the record will reflect.  State continues examination.  11:49 AM  Cross-Examination by Attorney Thomas-Schmidt.  11:52 AM  Attny Thomas-Schmidt no further questions.  11:52 AM  Witness excused.   No further witness by either party.   State request for bind over.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt makes argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial.  

Attny Thomas-Schmidt request to be heard on bond modification.  Attny Thomas-Schmidt makes argument.  State makes argument, opposes bond modification.  Court makes statement.  Court denies bond modification.
Arraignment scheduled for August 23, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
11:36 AM Defendant Eric W Larson appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Gabriel Pollak (Special Appearance) appeared in person.   Attorney Bruce Robert Poquette in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. DEF received copy of criminal complaint in court on this date.  DEF verifies DOB and  updates address. Defendant advised of rights/penalties, acknowledges receipt of complaint, waives reading of complaint.  Bond Continues.   DEF requests to have preliminary hearing to be set within time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
Preliminary hearing on July 27, 2022 at 11:45 am.
